title: [K-12] Personalized Science Inquiry Process Using Augmented Reality Learning Analytics

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of physics/chemistry concepts and fundamental smartphone operation skills
context.additional_context: All learners possess smartphones but lack PC environments; virtual simulations are necessary due to limited experimental equipment.

learning_goals: Learners can visualize three molecular structures (water, carbon dioxide, methane) using an AR application (e.g., MERGE Cube), measure each molecule’s bond angles with ≤5° error, and implement interactions (rotation, zoom) to write a lab report.
Provide personalized feedback based on individual learning pattern data at least three times

Based on a one-week learning analytics report, learners can specifically outline ≥3 self-directed learning strategies (e.g., time management, goal setting, feedback utilization) and develop an action plan meeting ≥4 of 5 teacher-verified checklist items.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
